What is Newton's first law of motion?
Answer: An object at rest will remain at rest| and an object in motion will remain in motion with a constant velocity| unless acted upon by a net external force.
Distractor1: Force is equal to mass times acceleration.
Distractor2: For every action| there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Distractor3: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net external force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.
